intro: Raimondia monoica, commonly known as the single-flowered raimondia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptations to arid and saline environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in a single head, which is a distinctive feature. Raimondia monoica is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a rare species within its native range.
